__e: And I didn't do it because I pitied you. I didn't do it out of any sense of humanity. I didn't even do it as a favour for your father.
Your mother is a woman of excellent understanding. Her concern for you is great, though wise and clear-eyed.
You think you're so smart that we want all you want.
But I have never made sense... until yesterday.
You could drive yourself crazy trying to figure it out. But I know one thing for sure:
You just don't make any sense, that's all. And neither do I.
A wise man once told me don't ask questions you don't want to know the answer to.
I just want to say: A wise man once said: You choose your friends, you get a family.
You can do this, but a wise man once said to me:
Monrad is an idiot. You should be smart enough to to keep the truth to yourself.
Who respects you? The wife who's smart enough to get rid of you, or the kids you never fucking see?
You're not smart enough to do what he can do.
Monrad is an idiot. You should be smart enough to to keep the truth to yourself.
You're not smart enough to do what he can do.
Who respects you? The wife who's smart enough to get rid of you, or the kids you never fucking see?
You need to make good decisions. I can. I do that.
You made a wise decision here today.
It turned out to be the right goddamn decision.
I don't think you're dumb. Just not as smart as I am.
And before she knows it, she's gonna be old and wise like us.
"Dad, am gonna be as smart as Mom when grow up?"
